title: A Quick cs Quiestion!
body:
When playing the three main cs roles (Top,Mid,Adc) do you roughly have a target amount of cs that you set as a goal to have at certain stage In the game? for example: 70cs at 10Mins? 
I say 70cs, 10 minutes into a game as a good mate of mine said its a rough target, Thoughts?

replies.body: When I play the donger i get 120 cs at 10 minutes or something
perfect CS at 10 minutes is 114, and that is the wave that just spawned in their base.

CS count is situational, considering one can't go out to meet an arbitrary goal when he is camped 24/7, and one can certainly cs more if he is sitting on a massive lead.

Generally, the average is around at least 100 cs within 20 minutes or so as the bare minimum benchmark across the entire map with the exception of supports.

CS'ing doesn't make you win games, it only helps you win easier so don't get too hung up on the count. As long as you cs more than your opponent you already have an edge, well not when you are playing strictly early game toons, since in that case kills matter too.

I understand cs being a situational aspect of the game, though now I've just hit sliver V, to get that competitive edge on my lane opponent I figured id start to better myself in the finer aspects of the game. So a little goal, is handy knowledge to have :) Thanks Sekai <3

I know pros go by 80 cs by 10 minutes and 200 cs by 20 minutes then 100 cs every 10 minutes from there.

But I'm no pro so usually my guideline is every 10 minutes I should be up 10-20 cs more. e.g. 10 minutes up 15 cs, 20 minutes up 30 cs etc etc

As a note, if you go by this and are in a matchup where you can stop the enemy from even being near CS, increase the numbers.

So example, if your enemy laners are zoned and your freezing, you should be increasing the gap by upwards of 30 CS per 10 minutes.
I appreciate the insight, something to keep in-mind!

My personal thing is this.

Hit tab, check the CS counts, if your a solo laner and not in the top 2/3 CS counts, there is a problem.

I don't go by number counts or anything, because put simply there are times where you can't CS (say for mid your roaming, or top you just shoved to TP bot)

There will always be circumstances where you will lose CS.
